intro: Rhabdophyllum barteri, commonly known as the Barter's rhabdophyllum, is a rare and unique plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhabdophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
